Job Posting:165530 - Position: S25 Full Stack Developer (Calgary) (4 or 8 Months) 165530 E2 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 02/04/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 01/21/2025 09:48 AM Expired ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country CGI Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Job Description 2025 - Summer S25 Full Stack Developer (Calgary) (4 or 8 Months) 165530 E2 Co-op Position Calgary, AB Canada 4 or 8 months Hybrid CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List • Category: Software Development/ Engineering • Main location: Canada, Alberta, Calgary • Position ID: J0125-0821 Employment Type: Student Internship • Position Description: We are seeking a hard-working Full Stack Developer looking to kick-start their career through joining our growing and dynamic team. This is a great opportunity to work under the mentorship of our Project and Program Manager to assist and support the development team in all design-related tasks. At CGI, our strength is built on our ability to work together. Our diverse set of backgrounds offer different perspectives and new ways of thinking. It encourages lively discussions, inspires thought leadership, and helps us build better solutions for our people and clients. We are seeking someone who thrives in this setting and is inspired to craft meaningful solutions through true collaboration. Start Date: May 5th, 2025 (4 or 8 Months) Location: Calgary - Hybrid Perks of Being a CGI Co-op: • Participate in monthly socials to meet co-ops across the country. • Access professional development workshops hosted by domain experts on topics ranging from how to be a top consultant, how to apply the agile methodology, data & analytics and more! To learn more about CGI and hear from our Co-ops and New Grads, visit www.cgi.com/startmycareer Your future duties and responsibilities: • To join and contribute to a cross-functional software development team. • Develop API services and web applications as per the client specifications using coding standards and standard methodologies. • Perform unit testing and defect fixes. • Participate in project planning meetings along with all relevant agile ceremonies. • Co-ordinate with business analysts and testing teams for delivery. • Work standard and additional overtime hours to meet project outputs and pager support. What you can expect from us: Together, as owners, let's turn meaningful insights into action. Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you'll reach your full potential because… You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That's why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company's strategy and direction. Your work creates value. You'll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise. You'll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You'll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons. At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist. Come join our team-one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world. Job Requirements Required qualifications to be successful in this role: What We're Looking for: • Willing to be a player of many hats • Takes accountability for results and exhibits a "can do" demeanor. • Has an appetite to continuously evolve and improve, address difficult problems and seek/give constant feedback. • Demonstrates flexibility and is able to move forward without having all of the answers. • Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment. Your Qualifications: • Must be part of an accredited Co-op Program • Experience with Java and/or .NET and familiarity with all stages of the SDLC lifecycle. • Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks such as Angular, VUE and React. • Currently enrolled in Computer Science related program. • Ready to complete 8-month co-op term • Basic knowledge of relational databases and SQL. • Analytical conduct and good problem-solving skills. • Superb communication and interpersonal skills. Skills: Communication (Oral/Written) Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Yes Address Cover Letter to Hiring Manager Special Application Instructions Application Link: https://cgi.njoyn.com/corp/xweb/xweb.asp?NTKN=c&clid=21001&Page=JobDetails&Jobid=J0125- 0821&BRID=1183460&lang=1 Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
